problem.markdown:
Which of the following is NOT a great example of abstraction, from what you've learned so far?
( ) A traffic light's color for a driver. (x) The height of a singer for a recruiter. ( ) Google's search results page. ( ) An elevator pitch for a screenplay. ( ) None of the above ( ) All of the above
[explanation] From all the examples above, only the second one serves as a bad example of abstraction. The color of a traffic light is important to let the driver know when to stop, start or slow down and to avoid crashing. Google provides a brief summary of each match so that you can choose the link you want. An elevator pitch is the perfect example of figuring out the big ideas of a screenplay.
The height of a singer is probably not as important as the quality of his voice or singing experience for the recruiter to take into consideration. [explanation]
